page.title: 03Our Square on the D block
page.content:
On 3rd July 1985 we visited Houghton Green pumping station.Mr. Peters took us down an underground tunnel. We saw large pipes going down 100 feet to a natural underground reservoir.It pumped 4.56 megalitres a day.It costs 18 pounds to pump one megalitre.The water is pumped 330 feet high.The water is processed with chlorine gas.Water is kept sealed from the air.It is used by both domestic and industrial users.It travels from Delph Lane pumping station to Winwick, Orford,Padgate and Cinammon Brow.The M6 / M62 Motorway{junction}crosses over that area on the map. In case of emergencies the pumping station can turn on the emergency water supply. The station was built in 1895.
Our water is very hard because of the lime content.
